ayat.ayahEn: Woe to the defrauders!

ayat.ayahArV1: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: الذين اذا اكتالوا على الناس يستوفون
ayat.ayahEn: Those who take full measure ˹when they buy˺ from people
but give less when they measure or weigh for buyers.
Do such people not think that they will be resurrected
for a tremendous Day—
the Day ˹all˺ people will stand before the Lord of all worlds?

ayat.ayahArV1: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِى سِجِّينٍ
ayat.ayahArV2: كلا ان كتاب الفجار لفي سجين
ayat.ayahEn: But no! The wicked are certainly bound for Sijjîn ˹in the depths of Hell˺—
and what will make you realize what Sijjîn is?—
a fate ˹already˺ sealed.
Woe on that Day to the deniers—
those who deny Judgment Day!

ayat.ayahArV1: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
ayat.ayahArV2: وما يكذب به الا كل معتد اثيم
ayat.ayahEn: None would deny it except every evildoing transgressor.

ayat.ayahArV1: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayat.ayahArV2: اذا تتلى عليه اياتنا قال اساطير الاولين
ayat.ayahEn: Whenever Our revelations are recited to them, they say, “Ancient fables!”

ayat.ayahArV1: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: كلا بل ران على قلوبهم ما كانوا يكسبون
ayat.ayahEn: But no! In fact, their hearts have been stained by all ˹the evil˺ they used to commit!

ayat.ayahArV1: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: كلا انهم عن ربهم يومئذ لمحجوبون
ayat.ayahEn: Undoubtedly, they will be sealed off from their Lord on that Day.
Moreover, they will surely burn in Hell

ayat.ayahArV1: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: ثم يقال هذا الذي كنتم به تكذبون
ayat.ayahEn: and then be told, “This is what you used to deny.”

ayat.ayahArV1: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْأَبْرَارِ لَفِى عِلِّيِّينَ
ayat.ayahArV2: كلا ان كتاب الابرار لفي عليين
ayat.ayahEn: But no! The virtuous are certainly bound for ’Illiyûn ˹in elevated Gardens˺—
and what will make you realize what ’Illiyûn is?—
a fate ˹already˺ sealed
witnessed by those nearest ˹to Allah˺.
Surely the virtuous will be in bliss
˹seated˺ on ˹canopied˺ couches, gazing around.
You will recognize on their faces the glow of delight.
They will be given a drink of sealed, pure wine

ayat.ayahArV1: خِتَـٰمُهُۥ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلْمُتَنَـٰفِسُونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: ختامه مسك وفي ذلك فليتنافس المتنافسون
ayat.ayahEn: whose last sip will smell like musk. So let whoever aspires to this strive ˹diligently˺.
And this drink’s flavour will come from Tasnîm—
a spring from which those nearest ˹to Allah˺ will drink.

ayat.ayahArV1: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَضْحَكُونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: ان الذين اجرموا كانوا من الذين امنوا يضحكون
ayat.ayahEn: Indeed, the wicked used to laugh at the believers
wink to one another whenever they passed by

ayat.ayahArV1: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِينَ
ayat.ayahArV2: واذا انقلبوا الى اهلهم انقلبوا فكهين
ayat.ayahEn: and muse ˹over these exploits˺ upon returning to their own people.

ayat.ayahArV1: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: واذا راوهم قالوا ان هؤلاء لضالون
ayat.ayahEn: And when they saw the faithful, they would say, “These ˹people˺ are truly astray,”
even though they were not sent as keepers over the believers.

ayat.ayahArV1: فَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: فاليوم الذين امنوا من الكفار يضحكون
ayat.ayahEn: But on that Day the believers will be laughing at the disbelievers
as they sit on ˹canopied˺ couches, looking on.

ayat.ayahArV1: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
ayat.ayahArV2: هل ثوب الكفار ما كانوا يفعلون
ayat.ayahEn: ˹The believers will be asked,˺ “Have the disbelievers ˹not˺ been paid back for what they used to do?”
